title: Traffic Lights
statementHtml:
You are given a simple undirected connected graph of nn vertices and mm edges.

There is a token in vertex 11. We consider the initial time to be at 00 seconds. After tt seconds, if the token is in vertex uu, you must do exactly one of the following:

The order of edges of a vertex is the order that they appear in the input.

Calculate the minimum time required to move the token from vertex 11 to vertex nn, and the minimum time spent waiting that can be achieved while minimizing the total time.

∗∗xmodyxmody denotes the remainder from dividing xx by yy.
inputSpecHtml:
Each test contains multiple test cases. The first line contains the number of test cases tt (1≤t≤10001≤t≤1000). The description of the test cases follows.

The first line of each test case contains two integers nn, mm (2≤n≤50002≤n≤5000, n−1≤m≤n(n−1)2n−1≤m≤n(n−1)2) — the number of vertices and edges in the graph, respectively.

Then mm lines follow, the ii-th line containing two integers uiui and vivi (1≤ui,vi≤n1≤ui,vi≤n) — the vertices of the ii-th edge.

It is guaranteed that the graph is connected and simple.

It is guaranteed that the sum of nn over all test cases does not exceed 50005000, and the sum of mm over all test cases does not exceed 5⋅1055⋅105.
outputSpecHtml: For each test case, output a single line containing two integers — the minimum total time and the minimum waiting time that minimizes the total time, respectively.
noteHtml:
In the first test case, an optimal strategy is to do the following:

  • at time 00, wait one second,
  • at time 11, move the token from vertex 11 to vertex 55,
  • at time 22, wait one second,
  • at time 33, move the token from vertex 55 to vertex 66.

In the second test case, an optimal strategy is to do the following:

  • at time 00, move the token from vertex 11 to vertex 22,
  • at time 11, move the token from vertex 22 to vertex 11,
  • at time 22, move the token from vertex 11 to vertex 44.
